intro: Satureja macrocalyx, commonly known as broadleaf savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its foliage is often used in cooking for its pungent, slightly minty flavor. Botanically, it belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like mint and thyme.
